title: How Much Did You Study?
question_text:
Students at a large local high school wondered how much studying the juniors did for their college entrance exam. They conducted a survey asking, “How much did you study for your last college entrance exam?” All $300$ juniors in the school responded to the survey. The resulting data are shown in the two-way table below.
MaleFemaleTotal
Studied A lot$40$$60$$100$
Studied A little$70$$60$$130$
Did not study at all$50$$20$$70$
Total$160$$140$$300$
If we selected a junior from the school at random, what is the probability that the student selected is a female, given the student responded they studied a little?

distractor_explanations.B: Choice 'B' is incorrect. This is the probability of studied a little, given the selected student is female.
distractor_explanations.C: Choice 'C' is incorrect. This is the probability that the randomly selected student is female AND studied a little.
distractor_explanations.D: Choice 'D' is incorrect. This is the probability that the randomly selected student is female OR studied a little.
distractor_explanations.E: Choice 'E' is incorrect. This is the probability that the randomly selected student is male, given the student responded they studied a little.
